Class Flight

java.lang.Object
Flight
public class Flight extends Object
Represents the graphic representation of the route of a flight within the Iceepeecee simulation. A flight is defined by its color, starting and ending coordinates, and can have a photograph associated with it. This class provides methods to manipulate the visibility of the flight, take photographs along the route, and retrieve information about the flight and its associated photograph.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Juliana Brice√±o & Cristian Alvarez

      public Flight(String color, int[] from, int[] to)
      Create a flight with a specified color, starting, and ending coordinates.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the flight.
      from - Coordinates of the starting point of the flight.
      to - Coordinates of the ending point of the flight.

      public int[][] getLocation()
      Get the location of the flight represented as starting and ending coordinates.

    • makePhoto

      public void makePhoto(int theta)
      Capture a photograph along the flight's route with a specified theta angle. The photograph is associated with the flight.
      Parameters:
      theta - The angle at which the photograph is taken.

    • makePhoto

      public void makePhoto(double theta)
      Capture a photograph along the flight's route with a specified theta angle. The photograph is associated with the flight.
      Parameters:
      theta - The angle at which the photograph is taken.

    • getPhotograph

      public Photograph getPhotograph()
      Get the photograph associated with the flight.
      Returns:
      The Photograph object associated with the flight, or null if no photograph has been taken.
